ygData.subject: Re: stuff
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Do not forget dueling and PVP combat.  The bow is a warrior types ultimate defense.  When you are rooted, switch to your bow.  You can still do damage at
ygData.messageBody:
> I find that it's the enemy. I'll hit a giant rat every time, while young
> kodiaks I usually miss. Bows are better for support or for taking on enemies
> more of your level.
> -Rennin of E'Ci
> Trade Council GM

Do not forget dueling and PVP combat. The bow is a warrior types ultimate
defense. When you are rooted, switch to your bow. You can still do damage at
range and if you time your shots you can disrupt a spell. They are also useful
for pulling enemies to you and for killing those that are running away. Also, a
group with one caster who can root and 5 archers can take a small breather from
normal combat by switching weapons. Also good in normal combat where one of your
members is hurt. If he backs off, he can use the bow and usually not build up
too much aggression.

Question: I am interesting in learning more about fletching. Can some one point
me to a webpage or FAQ so I do not waste everyone's time by repeating questions,
especially of a newbie nature. Thank you all.

~Krobuu
Ogre TradeMaster
E'Ci
